name: 2-hydroxy-3-methoxybenzoic acid
Reason: 2-hydroxy-3-methoxybenzoic acid has a melting point that we can compare to benzoic acid, which has a melting point of 120 degrees Celsius. The methoxy group introduces additional hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10 degrees Celsius. The hydroxyl group also contributes to the melting point due to increased molecular weight and hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +5 degrees Celsius. The carboxylic acid group can also participate in hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +5 degrees Celsius. The presence of these functional groups raises the melting point due to increased molecular weight and hydrogen bonding.
